list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She could not console the weeping child.

list_definition.definition: a flat board with the controls and buttons for a machine or a piece of electronic equipment

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: the flight console of an aircraft.

list_definition.mean_english: thiết bị chơi game cầm tay
list_definition.definition: a small piece of electronic equipment which is connected to a screen for playing video games
a cupboard for a piece of electronic equipment such as a television.

list_ex_of_english: I do not think that we are very much consoled by that assurance, because as a matter of fact we knew it all along.
The taxpayer is consoled by being told that the rate of interest is to be kept low.
I am consoled by having access to quantities of music which was composed in an era when these lopsided artistic values did not obtain.
We fought hard against those changes at the time, but when we lost the fight we consoled ourselves with the thought that at least we still had our hospital.
I am quite sure that miners will feel in no way consoled by the fact that a £2,500 mink coat can now be bought for £2,300.
I make no apology for harassing or embarrassing them or for not consoling them in their dilemma.
However, he consoled me by saying that the fundamental basis of government policy was to encourage people to give to charities.
Assuager of my cares, softly consoling clavichord!
